text: <@U7SL518D6> i wanted to tag you in case you didn’t see my response above. let me know if HubSpot support would be a better avenue. thanks!

Very very strange.

Asking because I’ve seen someone do this before - are you using Dropbox/Google Drive/another folder sharing service to sync your dev assets amongst your team to your local machine? This seems like an issue you’d experience with that kind of set up.
I am not. It actually happened to me again this morning. So much for the restart. :sob:
Our other dev couldn’t pinpoint it either. It happens so randomly.

As far as whether to contact HubSpot support - they’ll be able to 1:1 troubleshoot a little faster than I can just because I’m 1 person vs there’s a ton of support folks.

That said, this is a really strange issue and without knowing what commands are happening before it occurs, it’s simply bizarre.

You explained it’s happening every morning and it happens regardless of a reboot. It kinda makes me wonder if there’s a security/IT software with a schedule to scan/do something on your work computers - and the config file is just getting mistreated.
I don’t even think the CLI has a mechanism for removing credentials from a config file. Just renaming, listing, and changing default
Sorry, that was a bit confusing. It’s not happening every morning with her…i was just saying she reboots every morning. The config file issue happens at random.
Well its good (kind of) to know its not just me. Let me know if you hear about this issue from anyone else.

The best thing I can say right now is to pay close attention to what actions you’re taking using the CLI.

If you notice it happens after a specific command gets run, let us know right away what command it is -we’ll start digging through the code to try to figure it out.

The next step in the process would be that we’d want you to try re-authing one of the accounts that keeps dissapearing. Then run that specific command that causes the issue but do it with `--debug` at the end. This will cause it to provide debugging information I can give to the team.

So far your team’s case is the only one I’ve seen.
